page.title: 15FARMING 2
page.content: 88% of the block is farmland in which 68% is wheat,barley and oats.There are potatoes,peas and beans grown as well.Once the fields used to be small with hedges around them to stop soil erosion,but nowadays the fields are big and flat,so that the farmer gets the most out of the land.Fertilizer is put on more and spraying is also done in a big way.Most of the farms put the grain into Silos and sell it during the summer and winter to bigger storage places,such as in Tangmere.The wheat is then sold to bakeries,chicken farmers to feed the chickens or sent to foreign countries. By Simon Kennedy.
